data.title: Celtics buzz: Rasheed Wallace fights his fines, and Ray Allen battles juvenile diabetes
data.meta_description: The Celtics big man will contest his $30,000 fine for criticism of officials.
data.text:
Celtics big-man Rasheed Wallace had an expensive holiday weekend.

According to a story on Boston.com, the league's leader in technical fouls was fined $30,000 for his comments following Friday's win over the Toronto Raptors.

In the game, Wallace was whistled for a technical after calling Toronto’s Hedo Turkoglu a flopper. Later, Paul Pierce received a technical foul after taunting Chris Bosh following a dunk. The combination of the two calls led Wallace to make comments that the league deemed “public criticism of officials.’’

That’s not to say Wallace will be reaching into his wallet without a little further explanation from the league.

• Future Hall of Famer Ray Allen is marketing his new t-shirt, a “What Would Jesus Shuttlesworth Do?” shirt, for charity at

muzeconnects.com

.

A tribute to his lead role in the cult classic Spike Lee film “He Got Game,” the T is being used to raise money for the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation.

Juvenile Diabetes is a topic of great interest in the Allen household. Allen’s 2-year-old son, Walker, was released from a four-day diabetes-related hospital stay just hours before Sunday’s game in Miami.
